message_1: A person has 6 identical friends and he wants to invite any number of them for dinner. In how many ways can he make the invitation if he wants to invite at least two people?
message_2: Since the friends are identical, the only thing that matters is the number of friends invited. The person can invite 2, 3, 4, 5, or all 6 friends. There are 5 different options for the number of friends to invite, so there are 5 ways to make the invitation.
